column1: The land now called Moraga was first inhabited by the Saklan Native Americans who belonged to the Bay Miwok language group.Joaquin Moraga was the grandson of José Joaquín Moraga
column2: builder of the Presidio of San Francisco and founder of the pueblo that grew into the city of San Jose. Joaquin's father Tenzin Moraga was also a soldier
column3: and an early explorer who named many of the state's rivers
column4: including the Sacramento and San Joaquin.

column1: Moraga is located on the 1835 Mexican Land Grant Rancho Laguna de Los Palos Colorados given to Joaquin Moraga and his cousin
column2: Juan Bernal. Part of that grant was the property today known as Moraga Ranch. The Moraga Adobe has been preserved and is located in neighboring Orinda. Joaquin Moraga Intermediate School
